title: Events
text:
Thursday, 12 September 2024
6–8pm
The embodiment of over-the-top ’80s Cold War Americana, Rocky IV was described by critics at the time as “a laughable turd” and the “last gasp” of the Rocky franchise. But with the benefit of hindsight—and a recently-released Director’s Cut with tighter focus—contemporary critics have given the movie much more credit, both for its archetypical embodiment of 1980s popular media, and for its central themes of breaking free of past codes and standing as an individual against an apparently-insurmountable collective machine. Join us as we take a look at this film and its resonance with the struggle for individuals to do something truly radical and new within another collective machine—the Ivory Tower.









Following soon





Details forthcoming!
